question: Who committed the most daring murder of Sir Curzen Wyllie in 1907 in a public meeting in London?
explanation: Madan Lal Dhingra was an Indian student at the University of London. He was associated with the India House of London which was set up by Shyamji Krishna Varma and The Indian Sociologist. Sir William Curzon Wiley was assassinated in London on 1st July 1909 by Dhingra at the Imperial Institute while he attending an event organised by the National Indian Association.
